headline: GTM Engineer @ DevCommX | Enabled $1.5M ARR via AI Signal & Intent Systems | Clay + n8n Automation | Built Scalable GTM Infrastructure | Signal‑Driven Outbound
about:
Most GTM teams scale by hiring. I scale by building systems.

I'm a GTM Engineer who architects signal-driven pipelines that turn behavioral data into qualified conversations.

THE TRACK RECORD
→ $1.5M ARR via signal-based flows
→ 11-14% reply rates (vs 2-3% industry avg)
→ 2-3x improvement in outbound response
→ $20K saved per quarter through automation
→ 20 manual hours eliminated weekly
→ 5x increase in positive responses

THE PROBLEM YOU'RE FACING

Your GTM is stuck:

- Static sequences while buyers are dynamic
- Drowning in tools, starving for insights
- Reply rates dropping despite "personalization"
- Chasing volume instead of signals
- More SDRs is your only growth plan

THE SOLUTION I BUILD

GTM infrastructure that responds to behavior:

→ Signal Systems – Real-time triggers (funding, hiring, tech changes)
→ AI Outreach – Custom models trained on 200+ campaigns (11-14% replies)
→ Automation – Clay + n8n flows, CRM enrichment, multi-touch warming
→ GTM Design – ICP profiling, velocity optimization, attribution

Tech Stack: Clay, n8n, Gemini 3, Smartlead, Salesforce, 15+ APIs

TYPICAL RESULTS (90 Days)
→ 2-3x reply rate improvement
→ 30-50% faster sales cycles
→ 40-60% less manual prospecting
→ $15K-$25K quarterly savings

WORK WITH ME
📧 DM : "LOGIC"
Follow for GTM engineering, signal-based outbound, and AI automation insights.

updates.postText:
R.I.P. to generic cold emails.

Gemini 3 didn’t just outperform GPT-5… it straight up embarrassed it.

I’ve tested every major model for outbound over the last 6 months.
 
GPT-5, Claude, Llama, Qwen… all solid.
But outbound doesn’t reward “solid.”
Outbound rewards precision.
So I built my own Custom Gem on top of Gemini 3
trained purely on behavioral buying signals, top-performing GTM copy, and 200+ real campaign outcomes.

And the thing is scary.
→ 11–14% reply rates
→ Positive responses up 5x
→ Zero fluff, zero generic filler
→ Writes contextual emails with psychological triggers embedded

Here’s what makes it different:

1. It profiles your ICP like a strategist
Not just job title.
It reads pain patterns, tech stack gaps, growth stage signals, and buying triggers.

2. It writes like a human, not a template factory
Short, sharp, specific.
It mirrors tone, trims noise, and hits timing windows.

3. Plug-and-play for Smartlead, Instantly.ai, Clay, n8n
Outputs are pre-formatted for deliverability and multi-step flows.

4. Drafts a ready-to-send email in 30–40 seconds
No tweaking, no rewriting.

I’m sharing the whole system:
 → The Custom Gem
 → The ICP logic
 → The prompt framework
 → The exact structure that’s crushing it right now

headline: Investor | Mergers & Acquisitions | Marketing Strategist | Serial Entrepreneur
about:
As a seasoned Real Estate and Business Acquisitions Specialist, I have a proven track record in identifying and closing profitable deals for my clients. I specialize in working with private lenders and alternative lending sources to secure financing for my clients' projects.

With my deep understanding of market trends and financial modeling, I am able to structure deals that provide attractive returns for private lenders and alternative lending partners. My strong negotiation skills and ability to build relationships with key players in the industry allow me to secure financing at competitive rates.

Whether you are a private lender looking for high-return investments or an entrepreneur seeking alternative financing options, I am here to help. My extensive network of lending partners and deep understanding of the industry make me the go-to specialist for real estate and business acquisitions. Let's work together to find the perfect deal that meets your investment goals.

experiences.title: Sovereign Imperial Wealth Associates – (S.I.W.A)
experiences.jobDescription:
At Sovereign Imperial Wealth Associates, our commitment to financial excellence extends beyond traditional boundaries. Building on our illustrious history, we leverage sophisticated banking instruments such as Standby Letters of Credit (SBLC) and Medium Term Notes (MTNs) to propel our clients' ambitions in both international and domestic arenas.

Our adept team of financial artisans orchestrates these instruments with precision, creating a symphony of financial empowerment. SBLCs serve as the cornerstone of our international project financing, providing a robust guarantee that underlines our commitment to project success. Meanwhile, MTNs, with their versatility, become instrumental in diversifying investment portfolios and funding ambitious ventures on a global scale.

With a legacy steeped in financial acumen, we seamlessly integrate these instruments into our bespoke wealth management strategies. Whether funding infrastructure projects, real estate developments, or cutting-edge ventures, Sovereign Imperial Wealth Associates stands as the vanguard of utilizing advanced financial instruments to transform aspirations into reality.

In embracing SBLCs and MTNs, we transcend conventional financial paradigms, ensuring that our clients not only preserve their wealth but also flourish on a grand scale, echoing the opulence of a bygone era. Sovereign Imperial Wealth Associates – where the fusion of history, innovation, and financial mastery propels your ambitions to imperial heights.

headline: Broad-Based Entrepreneur | Content Creator |  Intersection of Business & Sport
addressWithCountry: Austin, Texas Metropolitan Area, United States
about:
Embracing what was once an idea, I continue to serve as the co-founder and sales director of Elite Car Care & Sales. We are a full service automotive shop and sales lot, where I serve as the creative mind around marketing, financing, capital budgeting, forecasting, and hiring. Proving how to build a business from the ashes has been a massive yet rewarding challenge. A true family-owned and operated small biz, we’ve seen annual revenue grow from 300K on the sales and service side in 2017 to a high of $2.7 million in 2022 with fixed output between $1.4MM to $2.7MM in the post-pandemic market.

The fact is I aim to parlay my business expertise into a future position within sports law, on the agency side. My long-term goal is to run a well-rounded agency or join a reputable sports representation firm.

about:
I help capital raisers, real estate operators, and CRE entrepreneurs build personal brands that attract investors, create deal flow, and scale trust online.

As the Founder & CEO of Booztbrand, I’ve helped professionals go from “posting randomly” to building brand systems that raise capital, attract clients, and drive consistent inbound opportunities.

My background in digital communication strategy taught me that visibility without positioning doesn’t convert. Most syndicators and founders are already credible — they just don’t have a brand engine that tells their story in a way investors can trust.

That’s where we come in.

At Booztbrand, we build authority-driven brand systems that help:
✅ Raise awareness with the right investors and clients.
✅ Build trust through strategic content and storytelling.
✅ Automate lead generation and nurture using systems like GoHighLevel.

Our clients have doubled investor engagement, raised seven figures in capital, and built reputations that attract high-value opportunities — all by showing up with clarity, confidence, and consistency.

If you’re in the business of raising capital or selling a premium service, and you’re ready to position yourself as the go-to authority in your market, let’s connect.

📩 DM me or book a Brand Strategy Call.

experiences.title: Founder & CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
When I decided to leave my secure government employment, working as a digital communications advisor, I did not leave it because "I didn't like it" Or "I wanted to make more money" etc. I left it because I understood the power digital media had to truly change people's lives for the better. 

I understood that in today's digital era, consumers craved more than just products or services—they seek purpose, connection, and authenticity. And that the only way to do that is by empowering the founders, the entrepreneurs, with the tools they need to truly connect to people who need their products and services. 

 At Booztbrand, we're on a mission to bridge this gap between individuals and their business success.

We empower founders to authentically connect with their audience, nurturing existing relationships and attracting new ones. Our tailored strategies help clients establish authority, reach ideal targets, and showcase their unique value propositions. Through our expertise, businesses position themselves to attract clients effortlessly via social media.

We understand that navigating social media can be daunting, but we see it as a powerful tool for growth and success. By focusing on the benefits and leveraging its potential, we help businesses thrive in the digital landscape.

If you're ready to unlock your next stage of growth, feel free to contact us at engagement@booztbrand.com

headline: I help DOT/Ports/ Cities/Counties/Road Construction Work Zone Service Providers collect transportation data. By reducing wait/dwell times, our iNode platform brings value added visualisations and insights.
jobLocation: 211-35 Auriga Drive, Ottawa Ontario Canada K2E 8B7
about:
To help you understand what we do at SMATS Traffic Solutions: 
https://www.smatstraffic.com/webinars

o Our technology helps revolutionize the way our customers collect traffic data. Big data has transformed the way city planners and transportation department do their jobs. Be it real-time or historic traffic data, data of motorists/truckers, cyclists or pedestrians, traffic data on city roads, highways, roads within or leading to ports we help our customers access it at the push of a button. 
o Our proprietary AI-powered data analytics platform, iNode, ingests big transportation data and interprets them into patterns and insights. 
o Measuring travel times, signal analytics and conducting origin-destination studies (smart cities).
o Predicting wait times, turn times, identifying traffic patterns and optimizing asset management (smart ports).

Synopsis of our Historic Crowdsourced Traffic Analytics from iNode:
o We collect data from TomTom which has a penetration rate of over 20% consisting mostly of passenger car GPS data.
o Our platform enables historical metrics such as travel time and speed data spanning up to 10 years of speed compliance screening, junction analytics, turning movement counts, network-wide origin-destination analytics among other metrics. This provides a cost-effective alternative to manual and hardware-based data collection with a unique value proposition compared to similar solutions.
o This would be a great way to reduce reliance on manual data collection, be proactive with safety screening and automate much of the analysis required.

Real-time Crowdsourced Traffic Analytics from iNode:
o Primarily designed for traffic operations or Traffic Management Centers (TMC).
o We source data from partners like Google and Tom Tom.
o The platform offers real-time metrics on travel times, segment delays and average speeds between points of interest. Great for ad-hoc event management, ad-hoc signal retiming, monitoring construction zones/detours, etc.
o Operates on a pay-per-use model - Simply draw out segments of interest in our GIS application; they’re not predefined and can go as small as 100ft segments - schedule data collection and enable automated visualizations and reporting.

For a one on one discussion and our online demo, feel free to reach me direct:
Brian Mendonca
SMATS Traffic Inc
Tel : 1(888)-441-5666 x -106
email: brian@smats.ca
www.smatstraffic.com

experiences.title: Business Development
experiences.jobDescription:
Speed and Travel Time Data: 
This data helps identify bottlenecks and prioritizes areas needing signal timing adjustments based on time of the day/week with a one day lag allowing validation as early as next day. High accuracy speed data across the network reduces the need to physically collect this data and speed compliance analysis can be used to prioritize traffic calming measures and validate their effectiveness before and after.

Origin Destination Data: 
Our sample size data reduces the need for ground based re-identification sensors and provides comprehensive metrics across the network. We can also enable micro OD studies in smaller neighborhoods where other sources fall short. With our 25% sample size, we calibrate with statewide/local data to provide upto 95% confidence intervals for volume estimates like ADT, AADT and MADT. For now, we are redefining our Turning Movement Counts module which will be available soon. 

Radars: 
Smartmicro Forward Firing Radar: Our Smartmicro integrations offer a forward-firing solution tracking over 1000ft with 98% count accuracy. This method is more robust than side-firing allowing for more objects to be tracked per unit time. The radar can classify pedestrians, cyclists and various vehicle sizes with real-time data collection synced to our cloud-based analytics platform. Additional features include queue detection, stopped vehicle detection, wrong-way detection and Bluetooth sensing for travel time, speed and OD metrics.

headline: Focused on outcomes that matter from healthcare to scalable GTM systems
addressWithCountry: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
about:
At the core of my work is a simple motivation: improving healthcare and the lives of the people it serves. Real progress comes from meaningful conversations with healthcare professionals and the ability to translate complex ideas into practical solutions that are actually implemented.

Somewhere along the way, people started calling me the McConaughey of GTM 🤠 
I’m not exactly sure how it started, but it stuck because it reflects how I show up. Curious, consistent, and grounded in purpose, with a strong belief that trust and follow-through matter just as much as strategy.

I’ve built my career at the intersection of healthcare, customer success, and go-to-market execution. That work has included managing more than 200 provider relationships, supporting new product launches, and driving adoption across complex clinical environments. Through those experiences, I’ve learned that growth happens when people feel heard, supported, and confident in the solutions they’re adopting.

Alongside enterprise healthcare, I carry a strong entrepreneurial spirit. I enjoy building from ambiguity, creating clarity where systems fall short, and helping teams design GTM and customer success motions that scale without losing the human element. Much of my work lives at the intersection of data, process, and relationships, where thoughtful execution turns intent into lasting impact.

I’m passionate about healthcare innovation, customer success, and GTM strategy done the right way. My focus is on connecting people, systems, and purpose to drive adoption, retention, and long-term outcomes that genuinely matter. If you’re building in healthcare or SaaS and care deeply about impact, execution, and meaningful growth, I’d love to connect.

experiences.title: Territory Business Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
I support healthcare providers across the San Francisco Bay Area to Santa Cruz, partnering with endocrinologists, cardiologists, nephrologists, and primary care teams to improve outcomes for patients living with chronic cardiometabolic disease.

My focus includes:

• Promoting Afrezza®, a rapid-acting inhaled mealtime insulin that helps people with Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes better manage post-prandial glucose and live more freely in the moment
• Supporting Furoscix®, a subcutaneous furosemide therapy that enables CKD and CHF patients to effectively remove excess fluid at home, helping reduce hospitalizations and improve quality of life
• Educating providers on appropriate patient identification, clinical differentiation, and real-world use cases
• Building trusted long term relationships with healthcare professionals by aligning clinical evidence with patient-centered care goals
• Collaborating cross-functionally to drive adoption, access, and sustained utilization across the territory

At the core of my role is helping patients stay out of the hospital, stay present in their lives, and regain a sense of control through innovative therapies that meet them where they are.

updates.postText:
Are you a sports fan or are you a fan of the business of sport?

If you're trying to work in sports, you need to know the difference.

Sports fans think working in sports is a luxury. Hanging out with players and coaches, getting access to the locker room, behind the scenes meetings, and your typical 9-5.

What working in sports actually looks like is long hours, working nights and weekends (sometimes in terrible weather), limited to no player/coach access, low pay and missed holidays, birthdays, weddings, etc. 

I don't say this to discourage anyone from working in the sports industry. 

I've been lucky enough to have done it throughout my career so far and have absolutely loved it. 

But in order to make it work, you need to be a fan of the business WAY more than a fan of a team.

You need to love the marketing, sales, operations, sponsorship, promotions, activations, experiences, social, digital, content creation, and more if you're going to make it.

Luckily, most of the people you'll work with will share the same passion for the business side and you'll create more memories in the first few years than most people will experience in their entire life.

And that is truly why people want to work in sports.

This is the text message I received at 1:00 PM on Friday.

Prior to this, I had only talked to this individual for 10 minutes on the phone.

A call that he had not prepared for wasting both of our time.

Before that, we had never met. Never had a conversation. No connection.

I understand it's incredibly hard to break into the sports industry.

It's an absolute grind to not only get in, but to stay in, and to grow.

However, if you are reaching out to people on LinkedIn to network to try to "get your foot in the door", please allow me to offer some advice.

1. BE READY

If someone is offering to give you a few minutes to chat with them on the phone, do not ask about their journey or how they got to where they are today. That's what LinkedIn profiles are for. 

Instead, dig deeper and ask insightful questions. Look at what the company is doing, what new products they just launched, a new marketing campaign, etc. When you reference something relevant, it makes it 100x more likely the individual will take you more seriously.

2. BE DELIBERATE

If there is a specific department, job, or team you're interested in, do your best to find people involved in that work. Have a clear idea of what you want to discuss, what you want to do in your career, or what you want to learn from the conversation.

3. BE THANKFUL

If someone offers to speak with you, please send them a thank you email. Bonus points if you reference something that made an impact on you from the conversation. It will take 2 minutes for you to do and will leave a great lasting impression.

If there's any I missed, which I'm sure there are, mention them in the comments. Let's help the next generation trying to enter the workforce.

This 👏 is 👏 how 👏 you 👏 do 👏 it

Here's why it works:

1. TIMING

This message came in within an hour of my post going out. Now, I'm not saying you need to constantly be on LinkedIn but responding or reaching out within 24-48 hours is a good bet.

2. RELEVANT

He referenced my post and made a light joke about it. It's incredibly hard to pull off humor to strangers but this definitely caught my attention.

3. RESEARCH

New Balance sponsored athletes like Shohei Ohtani and Francisco Lindor are generating a ton of exposure for the brand during the MLB playoffs. This individual did a great job by pointing how he personally has seen it.

Short, sweet, and to the point.

headline: Freight Forwarding | Air & Ocean | OOG / Heavy Lift | Project Cargo | Asset-Based (Port Newark & Savannah)
jobTitle: Head of International Logistics & Strategic Partnerships
companyIndustry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
about:
I lead International Sales Development & Strategic Partnerships at TRT International, a 30+ year asset-based logistics operator with port-side facilities in Newark and Savannah.

My work focuses on building global partnerships, opening new revenue channels, and supporting organizations that rely on dependable U.S. logistics — from commercial shippers to nonprofits with mission-critical supply chains.

I collaborate with leaders and teams who need:
• reliable U.S. port execution
• fast coordination for time-sensitive freight
• a single accountable partner (no intermediaries)
• support for oversized, complex, or high-value cargo movements

Across my career at TRT, I’ve developed strong relationships with freight forwarders, manufacturers, project cargo teams, and nonprofit organizations — always with an emphasis on trust, clarity, and long-term partnership.

If your work involves global freight, international operations, or U.S. import/export strategy, I’m always open to connect.

Lead new market penetration and strategic partnerships across the U.S., Germany/DACH, and Russian-speaking Europe, serving as TRT’s primary commercial representative

Personally manage and grow strategic freight forwarder and enterprise accounts, owning the full sales cycle from outbound and discovery through close and expansion

Develop and scale TRT’s sales teams in the U.S. and Europe, defining sales messaging, partner playbooks, and enterprise account strategy

Translate complex operational, financial, and risk constraints into solution-based sales engagements for freight forwarders and global partners

Collaborate with leadership to shape go-to-market strategy, pricing frameworks, and long-term partner development

By combining commercial leadership with deep port-side expertise, I help clients and forwarders streamline U.S. operations, reduce risk, and gain reliable end-to-end control without intermediaries. I lead initiatives that open new trade lanes, elevate customer experience, and build long-term partnerships rooted in trust, performance, and operational excellence.

updates.postText:
𝗜 𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗸 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗵𝘂𝗺𝗮𝗻 𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗹𝗼𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀 — 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝗽𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗿𝘆 𝗯𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘀𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝘃𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗱.

But professionally, I lead International Logistics & Strategic Partnerships at TRT International — and this is what our team actually does behind the scenes.

We’ve been operating since 1994, and over the decades one thing never changed:
𝗪𝗲 𝗳𝗶𝘅 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗺𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗯𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗸 𝗳𝗿𝗲𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗯𝗲𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗻𝘀𝗶𝘃𝗲.

At TRT International, our home base is directly at the Port of Newark — and that advantage shapes everything.

Here’s what that looks like:

𝗣𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝗡𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗸 – 𝗢𝘂𝗿 𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

150,000 sq ft warehouse directly at the port
15 acres of yard space
300+ chassis in rotation
Every piece of specialized equipment needed to handle OOG cargo
Full crating for export, fragile cargo, and project freight
No weight restrictions
Heavy-lift, transload, cross-dock, drayage, and urgent rescue moves
A team that steps in when others step back

𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗵𝗶𝘁𝘀, 𝘄𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗯𝗿𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻 — 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀, 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁-𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗲𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝗹𝘀𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘀.

We’re also a trusted partner for Fortune 100 companies who need someone that can step in fast, handle real volume, and clean up problems without slowing down their network.

For East Coast coverage, we operate a robust and growing Savannah operation — but Newark remains our heartbeat when speed matters most.

𝗦𝗲𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
Here’s a quick video overview:
https://lnkd.in/eUHzkFM4

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗪𝗲 𝗦𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆

If you ever need:

• a second set of eyes on a shipment
• support at the Port of Newark
• proper crating for fragile or export cargo
• help with OOG or heavy-lift
• guidance navigating the port
• emergency support during congestion

Our team is always here to help.
No pitch. No pressure. Just support.

If someone in the industry needs perspective, support, clarity, or help — I’m here.

Every week, I set aside 30 minutes of limited availability for anyone who wants to talk through a challenge, a problem, or simply needs an honest view from someone at the port.

If you ever need that time, here’s my calendar:
https://lnkd.in/e-SC2TmE
—
𝗣𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗵𝘁𝗲𝗿
Head of International Logistics & Strategic Partnerships
TRT International | Port Newark, NJ

A reminder that people move freight — not systems, not software, not tracking codes.
People in logistics don’t do their best
when they’re micromanaged.
They do their best
when they’re trusted to solve problems their own way.
Because the truth is simple:
The best logistics people thrive on ownership —
not supervision.
Give them room, and they move mountains.
Suffocate them, and they’ll do just enough to survive.
Trust isn’t soft.
It’s the strongest operational advantage a company can have.
At TRT, we try to trust our people first —
because trusted people move freight differently.

The Part of Warehouse Life Nobody Wants to Admit

I remember I walked into a warehouse floor a while back and watched supervisors timing bathroom breaks because their system flagged “too much idle time.”
And the tragic truth is this:
it wasn’t an exception.
It wasn’t a one-off.
It’s still a permanent thing in far too many warehouses.
Not leadership.
Not efficiency.
Dehumanization packaged as “process.”
When a pick rate matters more than basic human needs, you don’t have an efficiency problem.
You have a moral one.
And here’s the irony everyone in logistics knows:
The best warehouse teams don’t move faster because someone is holding a stopwatch.
They move faster because they feel respected, trusted, and treated like adults.
Respect is not a luxury in logistics.
It’s the only real productivity tool that lasts.
At TRT, we try to remember a simple truth:
every box that moves, moves because a human being did the work — not a metric.

headline: Founder, Living Code
addressWithCountry: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
about:
We are all living code: The sublime interplay of energy and information, at every scale in every moment.

I help individuals and organizations make deep sense of the world of business: Integrating head and heart, ethics and performance, work and play. 

I spent 15 years as a Buddhist monk, followed by 12 years in the software industry, in roles ranging from developer to Chief Product Officer. 

I have been a leading figure in the Salesforce DevOps space since 2014. I designed and patented several commercial products, taught and trained, led teams, and wrote the leading book on the Salesforce development lifecycle – Mastering Salesforce DevOps. 

I'm also co-author of Flow Engineering (IT Revolution Press), the leading book on value stream mapping as a tool for optimizing team work flow and psychological flow. 

My technical foundations are as a Salesforce architect, developer, and product leader, but my passion is for the human side of software development. I study the intersection of business, technology, and psychology through systems thinking, Lean, and Buddhist philosophy. I've dedicated my life to helping re-establish wisdom and ethics as core competencies in the business world.

Bringing peace and meaning to work creates organizations that learn, adapt, and thrive. Success in an increasingly high-tech world depends on our humanity more now than ever.

publications.title: Securing Salesforce: Hard Truths About Shared Responsibility
publications.summary:
By 2026, low-code technology is expected to be used to build about 75% of all new applications. Salesforce offers the ability to build low-code apps, but the security of these apps is not guaranteed. 

The experts that make up the Low-Code Security Alliance have worked together to provide both a snapshot of where low-code development is currently at as well as guidance on how to safely move forward. 

This guide explores key problems in Salesforce development security, drawing insights from interviews with industry experts.

publications.title: DORA Guide to Value Stream Mapping
publications.summary:
How to use value stream mapping to improve software delivery
A guide to value stream mapping.

publications.title: Flow Engineering
publications.summary:
Tired of misalignment, friction, and stalled workflow? Flow Engineering is a practical guide to using value stream mapping techniques to align teams, unlock innovation, and optimize performance. 

Based on foundations from Value Stream Mapping, cybernetics, and the Toyota Production System, Flow Engineering’s lightweight and iterative practices build the value, clarity, and flow required for effective collaboration and collective action. Written by Value Stream Mapping experts Steve Pereira and Andrew Davis, Flow Engineering provides a step-by-step guide for running fast-paced mapping workshops that rapidly build shared understanding.

publications.title: Mastering Salesforce DevOps: A Practical Guide to Building Trust While Delivering Innovation
publications.summary:
#3 Salesforce book of all time: https://bookauthority.org/books/best-salesforce-books
This practical guide brings DevOps principles to Salesforce development. It fits together two major movements within the IT world: the movement to Software/Platform as a Service (SaaS/PaaS), and the DevOps movement. While SaaS and PaaS allow companies to invest in their core competencies rather than maintain their own infrastructure, the goal of DevOps is to optimize the process of delivering software innovation and value.

The release of Salesforce DX in late 2017 unlocks the possibility of a true DevOps workflow on Salesforce. But DevOps is new to the Salesforce world and there is not a widespread understanding of its goals and methods, and so adoption of Salesforce DX is still in the early stages.

Mastering Salesforce DevOps explains how to build a powerful and comprehensive DevOps workflow for Salesforce―allowing you to finally deploy the world's most innovative platform using the world's most effective and efficient techniques. It addresses the need for a comprehensive guide to DevOps for Salesforce, allowing teams to bring proven practices from the IT world to resolve the hardest problems facing Salesforce developers today.

Andrew’s impact went far beyond product strategy and execution — he fundamentally shaped our company culture and inspired those around him to elevate their work and outlook.

Andrew consistently pushed us to think bigger and reminded us of the “why” behind what we were building. His insights and guidance challenged me to rethink my own approach to work and life, and I’m grateful for the lasting influence he’s had on my professional growth.

What truly set Andrew apart was his ability to connect with people. He brought positivity, empathy, and wisdom into every interaction, lifting the team's spirits while steering us toward ambitious goals. Conversations with him were both thought-provoking and energizing — a balance that made him not only a fantastic colleague but also a trusted friend.

I have no doubt Andrew will continue to have a transformative impact wherever he goes. Any organization fortunate enough to work with him will gain not just an exceptional leader, but someone who elevates the entire culture.

I had the pleasure of working with Andrew Davis during his time as Chief Product Officer at AutoRABIT, and it’s no exaggeration to say that he became, for me, the living embodiment of Lean principles. One of my most memorable experiences was co-hosting the Paper Chicken Factory with him for the Revenue Team leadership, It was a simple exercise that became a profound learning experience. 

What always stood out to me was Andrew’s ability to lead with calm, clarity, and reflection. Even in high-pressure situations, he brought a level of professionalism and composure that made him a grounding force for those around him. Whether he realized it or not, I learned a great deal from observing how he took the time to reflect before acting or speaking, a trait that continues to influence my own approach to leadership.

Beyond his product expertise, Andrew’s dedication to developing people was inspiring. His initiative to bring the Transformative Leadership course to life was more than a professional development opportunity; it reflected his commitment to nurturing thoughtful, intentional, and growth-oriented leaders.

recommendationsReceived.name: Kristin Baskett
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Product Manager | DevOps & CI/CD | Director of Software Marketing, Leading Successful Go-to-Market Strategies and Driving Revenue Growth and Retention
recommendationsReceived.context: Kristin reported directly to Andrew
recommendationsReceived.description: I've worked with Andrew over my last two companies; AutoRABIT and Copado. Andrew is an authority on Salesforce DevOps and has taught me a great deal about how Salesforce can help companies achieve big things and how we (the wider Salesforce DevOps ecosystem) can help them realize those goals quickly, securely and with killer quality. In addition to his deep subject matter expertise in Salesforce, he's led a game-changing program of 'people and process' improvement. All good technologists know that product is just one leg of the stool - and the people and process legs are equally important to achieve stability. Andrew has a heart for lean transformation. He's helped us identify waste, remove bottlenecks and get us to a place where we can quickly action feedback (while empowering the team that a decisive 'no' is also action). He's done this with a team that's geographically and culturally diverse and largely remote. I think that's the magic of true lean transformation - it is a set of transcending principles that work if you work them - no matter the makeup of your factory floor. I would say the biggest impact Andrew has had on my team is setting a precedent that it's safe and encouraged to say when things are broken and with the tools he's put in place we are able to think together in order to fix them. All of us are smarter than any one of us. Andrew has a gifted way of drawing out that collective intelligence in teams.

recommendations.subtitle: Salesforce DevOps Architect
recommendations.context: Andrew managed Saurabh directly
recommendations.description: I first worked with Saurabh on a Salesforce project at Wipro in 2017. I was so impressed with his intelligence and style of working that I insisted on bringing him into my next two projects. In fall 2017 when I founded the Amplify DX team at Wipro, I knew exactly who I wanted to be the lead architect on that project. Saurabh and I worked together daily for a year and a half until I left Wipro. At that time he took over many of my responsibilities and he's taken that project to the next level. I trust him implicitly with technical projects at any level of complexity. He's also played a critical role in mentoring and developing technical teams both in Salesforce and in DevOps.

recommendations.name: Evan Hodges
recommendations.subtitle: Associate Client Executive at Spotlight
recommendations.context: Andrew was Evan's client
recommendations.description: Evan has provide really solid support for our analyst relations activities. He's been organized, attentive, detail-oriented, and just generally great to work with. I appreciate his hard work and how quickly he's gotten to know our business and our needs.

recommendations.name: Brian Johnson
recommendations.subtitle: Product Marketing Manager | Competitive Intelligence | B2B SaaS Sales Collateral | Strategic GTM Insights
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Brian on the same team
recommendations.description: I had the privilege of working with Brian at Copado in his roles as both a Customer Advocacy Marketing Manager and as a Competitive Intelligence Marketing Manager. Brian is a consummate marketing professional with excellent cross-functional marketing skills and a keen sense of adding value where it's most needed in the organization. Wearing many hats here at Copado, he was an invaluable asset with a range of exceptional skills. I highly recommend Brian for any marketing role.

recommendations.name: Hemanth Kumar Gujjar
recommendations.subtitle: Founder & CEO @ Vasudhaiva Setu Mission | Rural Development, Youth, Women, PWD, 3rd Gender, Veteran Empowerment Health ❤️‍🩹- Education 📕 - Entrepreneurship 💼- Entertainment 🎥 #BringBackBharatBeforeBritish🇮🇳
recommendations.context: Andrew managed Hemanth Kumar directly
recommendations.description: I had the opportunity to work with Hemanth briefly and was very impressed by his clear mind, sincerity, and eagerness to learn. He picked up complex concepts very quickly and was very easy to work with. I'm confident he'd have a great impact in any team.

recommendations.name: Jasmine Hakki
recommendations.subtitle: Global Event Marketing, Salesforce + Splunk Alumni
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Jasmine on the same team
recommendations.description:
Well-run events are magical: A chance for people to connect, learn, share, and build connections.
But to make that magic happen requires a skillful magician behind the scenes.
Jasmine Hakki is that magician. Thinking through every aspect of the experience, from high-level planning to detailed logistics, is one of her key skills. The other is just being that calm, smiling face who greets people at the door and quietly fixes all the issues when Murphy's Law strikes.
I'd strongly recommend Jasmine to help in any organization that needs a skilled touch for creating a meaningful environment.

recommendations.name: Clodagh Meyer
recommendations.subtitle: Azure AI ☁️ Partner Manager @ Microsoft
recommendations.context: Andrew was Clodagh's client
recommendations.description:
I contracted with Clodagh when I was searching for a freelance editor to help craft rough transcripts into polished material. I told her from the outset that it would be a tricky job, requiring knowledge of organizational psychology, technology, business, and personal transformation. 
From the very beginning, Clodagh impressed me with her energy, sincerity, and commitment to the project. She was extremely reliable, an excellent communicator, and did a fantastic job working with a huge variety of content areas. It was a delight to work with her, and she made a challenging project run smoothly.
I'd highly recommend her for writing, editing, or communications work.

recommendations.name: Angie Coleman
recommendations.subtitle: Strategic Go-to-Market Expert | Innovative Agile Leadership | Results-Driven Agile Project Management
recommendations.description: Angie brings a pragmatic, detail oriented approach to managing teams and to managing Salesforce. She's clear and enthusiastic, but also has a no-nonsense attitude towards doing what organizations need. Her knowledge of Salesforce (its strengths and limitations) is extremely deep, so she's a fantastic technical resource. But her people management skills are what really bring value on a team.

recommendations.name: Jyoti Chaudhary
recommendations.subtitle: Global Head- Salesforce Practice at Altimetrik
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Jyoti but on different teams
recommendations.description: Jyoti has an enormous amount of experience in integration technologies. She's sharp, personable, and a fantastic leader. She's transformed the integration consulting practices at Appirio and been great to work with.

recommendations.name: Shilpa P.
recommendations.subtitle: Resource & Workforce Management Leader | Utilization & Bench Optimization | Capacity Planning, HR Ops & Executive Partnering
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Shilpa but on different teams
recommendations.description: Highly organized, responsive, and committed. Shilpa fills in all the cracks to hold an organization together, doing a wide variety of jobs to make a team successful.

recommendations.name: Abhishek Saxena ♾
recommendations.subtitle: Technical Architect @Copado
recommendations.context: Andrew managed Abhishek directly
recommendations.description:
I worked with Abhishek daily from September 2017 through July 2019 on the Appirio DX project. Appirio DX was a tiger team at Appirio to build developer tooling for our consultants. Managers from Appirio’s India office recommended Abhishek because of his familiarity with the release management process, his coding skills, and his passion for learning, developing, and teaching. After interviewing him for this role, I was convinced that he was an excellent choice for our team. He’s technically versatile, passionate about the development process, a fast learner, and genuinely concerned to help his colleagues. 
Over our 18 months of working together, I never regretted my decision. Abhishek showed tremendous enthusiasm for the project and for helping his fellow developers (informally and through numerous trainings). He successfully learned a dozen new technologies over the last year, as we integrated and built a wide range of custom and open source tools. He’s unusually articulate and a great communicator. He’s successfully led numerous customer-facing pre-sales and training efforts as well.
Since that time he’s become the most influential DevOps specialist in Appirio’s Canada team. I’d strongly recommend him for any roles related to Salesforce or DevOps more generally.

recommendations.name: Harrison Genson
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Sales Executive | Consultative Selling, Problem Solving
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Harrison but on different teams
recommendations.description: Open-minded, enthusiastic, and thoughtful, Harrison shows a great example of being ready to bring value.

recommendations.name: Harshita Khandelwal
recommendations.subtitle: Sr. Salesforce Application Engineer at Uber | 20x Certified Salesforce Application Architect
recommendations.context: Andrew was senior to Harshita but didn't manage Harshita directly
recommendations.description: Harshita did a fantastic job on a complex nonprofit project we worked on together. Hard working and well organized, she helped bring order and reliability to a complex and brittle system we'd inherited.

recommendations.name: Cameron Tyler
recommendations.subtitle: SVP & GM, Copado Solutions Group
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Cameron on the same team
recommendations.description: Cameron is an extremely organized, extremely professional marketer. She's quarterbacked the activities of Copado's marketing team, keeping track of hundreds of initiatives. She's skilled in taking creative chaos and grounding it in effective, systematic operations. Easy to work with and always on top of the situation.

recommendations.name: Karl Simon
recommendations.subtitle: Co-Founder & Chief Technology Officer @ Subatomic
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Karl but on different teams
recommendations.description:
Karl in adjectives: smart, humble, collaborative, patient, and insightful. Strongly recommend him on any leadership team or for any technical role.
I spent about a year working with Karl on one of the most challenging projects our company had ever tackled. The project involved well over 100 consultants, and the atmosphere was fast-paced, high-pressure, and not short on contentiousness. Karl had originally been contracted to be a technical lead, but was accidentally assigned to be a business analyst on the project based on the immediate needs. He took on that role without hesitation and started to organize one of the first major implementations of Salesforce CPQ. After a time, the needs changed and he was asked to work as a tech lead, which he shifted into without hesitation. In that capacity he was running calls with our team in India until close to midnight each night, sifting through code reviews and bug fixes, and guiding the activities of a large team of developers. Within a month or two, it was clear that he was bringing order to chaos and the team was thriving under his direction, so he was moved to being the overall technical implementation lead. 
He waded into the most contentious debates, and found agreement and amicability in the midst of conflict. He patiently dug into finding the root cause of the trickiest issues we faced, and persevered until they were resolved. His effect on the whole project was to bring sanity and agreement, when those had been in short supply. It was a great loss for the project when he decided to take an opportunity in the realm of data science. But fast forwarding a few years, he was the first person I turned to when data science became the topic at hand for my new organization. He's provided a patient, generous, and insightful sounding board for all things data science that I've needed to sift through. His versatility across technical, social, and business domains is very unusual, and he'd be an indispensable part of any technical or leadership team.

recommendations.name: Sreenath Gopal
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Architect, Technology Services at F5
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Sreenath on the same team
recommendations.description: I had the opportunity to work with Sreenath for a couple of years on an extremely complex Salesforce implementation for Hitachi. Sreenath is exceptionally patient, smart, and focused. He was the central coordinator for a very large group of specialists, but he kept the communication clear and enabled work to get done effectively. I've stayed in touch over the years that followed, and have been deeply impressed to see the improvements he's overseen in Hitachi's DevOps processes. He's mastered both the spirit of continuous improvement as well as the technical execution of DevOps on Salesforce. Quiet and thoughtful, but clear and confident, Sreenath is a natural leader who will change the dynamics of any team he's on.

recommendations.name: Justin Wigtion
recommendations.subtitle: Trusted Advisor to Enterprise Customers || Driving Success Through Partnership-First Relationships
recommendations.context: Andrew was senior to Justin but didn't manage Justin directly
recommendations.description:
Justin: smart, and gets things done.
Justin is a man of action: super-responsive, enthusiastic, committed to getting issues resolved in the most expedient way. Justin managed support for a very complex product, and was resourceful and fast in getting things fixed or routed to the solution asap.
It was always a pleasure to interact with him; he's a terrific team player, and an asset on any team.

recommendations.name: Ashna Malhotra
recommendations.subtitle: Frontend Developer | Javascript | Typescript | Booking.com
recommendations.context: Andrew managed Ashna directly
recommendations.description:
Ashna floats to the top in any group. When I started the Appirio DX project, I was asked what skills I needed in the team. But the only thing I knew was that I didn't know exactly what skills we'd need. I knew I needed people who were passionate about helping their fellow developers, who could learn a wide range of technologies very quickly, and who could solve problems creatively with little or no oversight. Ashna was the most junior member of our team. But she came recommended as the top of her class in the Appirio Ascend program. She was obviously smart, but what made the deepest impression when we interviewed her was her passion.
Within the first month on the project she learned Node, React, Redux, Electron, and a variety of smaller technologies. Over the 18 months I worked directly with her, she shaped the entire project through her contributions and went from trainee consultant to a powerful voice for DevOps on the Salesforce platform. Without hesitation, we've put her in front of major customers to represent our team and the entire company. She works tirelessly, understands complex concepts very quickly, and is enormously patient in helping her colleagues resolve challenges.
She's exceeded every expectation, and really helped lift our team to another level. I'd relish the chance to work with her again on any team, and am delighted I had a chance to see her entry into professional development. She'll make a massive impact wherever she goes, and I'm excited to see her contributions unfold.

recommendations.name: David Todman
recommendations.subtitle: Senior 3D Generalist & Team Leader
recommendations.context: Andrew was David's client
recommendations.description:
David prepared a complex video to simulate some of the challenges experienced in the software development process. He had less than a month to understand the challenges, create and iterate on a variety of visualizations, and craft a compelling presentation. To make the visualizations dynamic he scripted them in Python and animated them using Cinema 4D.
The end result was very impressive. We used the video in an innovation showcase, but I now use it whenever I'm doing training or sales related to the topic. This is the first animation I've ever seen about the DevOps process, and as such I think he did a wonderful job of conveying a complex scenario in an evocative way.
David was flexible, responsive, and concerned about our project. He was a pleasure to work with and was able to balance the artistic impact of the video with my insistence on making it accurate. I'd highly recommend him for teams needing any kind of animations or visualizations.

recommendations.name: Kapil Nainani
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Engineer
recommendations.context: Andrew was senior to Kapil but didn't manage Kapil directly
recommendations.description: Kapil was a star member of the Appirio developer tooling team. In a very short time he came up to speed on writing VS Code extensions and building desktop apps in Electron, React, and Redux. It was a tremendous pleasure to have a chance to work with Kapil. He's smart and gets things done. He's a great communicator and writer, is humble enough to take feedback and confident enough to correct the team if we're making mistakes. He's a hard worker with a great sense of humor and a natural insight into complex problems. I'd highly recommend him to any development team.

recommendations.name: Suraj Rajoria
recommendations.subtitle: Founder , CEO & Salesforce.com Architect at VirtuoWhiz
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Suraj but on different teams
recommendations.description: Innovative and energetic, Suraj took on numerous major challenges at Appirio. Most recently he lead an initiative to build a dedicated team supporting our Japan office, learning the language and culture and guiding the development team to improve code quality and testing to meet Japan's rigorous standards. Suraj has been humble, hard-working, thoughtful and genuinely concerned with the team around him. Previously we worked together in promoting Salesforce certification across Appirio, especially the difficult Platform Developer 2 certification. His technical skills are fantastic and I actively look for opportunities to work alongside him.

recommendations.name: Bruce Frager
recommendations.subtitle: Salesforce Architect, Business Transformation, Re-engineering and Optimization, 22x Salesforce Certified, Trailhead All Star Ranger (600), Mentor, Coach, Musician, Performer, Songleader, Low-content Book Author/Publisher
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Bruce but on different teams
recommendations.description: Bruce and I worked together in offering a Salesforce training. He's very knowledgeable in Salesforce, generous with his time, and gives clear explanations of difficult topics.

recommendations.name: Katherine Vahey
recommendations.subtitle: Delivery Leadership in Cloud Technologies | 5x Certified Salesforce Consultant | CPA Certificate | Big 4 Experience
recommendations.context: Andrew worked with Katherine on the same team
recommendations.description:
I was extremely impressed with Kitt's work as a project manager. We worked together on a very technically-complicated project facing a number of challenges. She patiently and methodically made sure that all issues were addressed openly as soon as they were discovered and that the team gained a clear understanding of each situation and the path to resolving it.
I was particularly impressed with her work empowering all of the team members to step up to their roles and drawing out the best in each of us. She welcomed contributions from everyone, but made sure that less-outspoken members of the team were given every opportunity to shine.
She was very patient and attentive throughout many highly-technical discussions. Her questions were penetrating; she let everyone contribute, but made sure that the conclusions were clear and that someone was taking responsibility for next actions. She lead most of our meetings, but even when she was in the background she was paying attention to what everyone was working on and removing any obstacles that would arise.
Her involvement was a major factor in navigating the project through a difficult phase, and I learned a lot from her about the value of project management done well.

headline: Partner at Executive Agency
about: Kyle is the creative vision behind Executive, leading the conversation around digital design and responsive web strategy. He fundamentally understands the strategic balance between current design trends and meaningful user experience when designing for evolving platforms. With a strong focus on promoting core ideas, Kyle’s less is more philosophy has helped businesses successfully express their identities across a range of media channels.

experiences.title: Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Executive is a leading brand strategy and digital design agency in Toronto. We help forward-thinking brands grow through the creation and revitalization of their branding and product offerings. Our clients range from start-ups to global brands and we have produced award-winning solutions that deliver real results. 

We specialize in branding and brand strategy, print and digital design, and the development of websites, web-based systems, e-commerce platforms and mobile apps.

experiences.title: Creative Director
experiences.jobDescription:
KNB is a Toronto based design studio founded in 2008 by art director and graphic designer Kyle Bleiman. We create strong visual concepts & deliver unique solu­tions that are strategically led. We focus on expressing a core idea from start to finish across all media and communication channels. We listen, research and then offer designs that dare to be different yet still stand the test of time.

Some of the companies I've worked with: Sony, Honda, Coca Cola, Herman Miller, Home Depot, Mercedes Benz, Shoppers Drug Mart, Microsoft, Coors, Red Bull and Honey Oats and Great Grains.

headline: Fractional Head of Narrative & Video @lumen8media | Making Complex Technology Easy to Understand Through Scalable Story Systems
about:
I help technical and mission-driven organizations clarify what they’re building, why it matters, and how to communicate it—especially through video.

I work as a fractional Head of Narrative & Video, partnering with executive leaders, engineers, educators, and researchers to design storytelling systems that support real understanding and adoption—not just content output.

My background spans executive video, education, engineering-adjacent teams, and high-stakes environments where clarity, emotional intelligence, and credibility matter as much as technical accuracy. I’m often brought in when teams are growing quickly, launching something complex, or struggling to explain their work beyond their inner circle.

Rather than acting as a one-off producer, I design the narrative structure, guide executive presence on camera, and help teams build scalable content systems they can sustain over time.

Current focus:
• Fractional narrative & video leadership
• Messaging and clarity diagnostics
• Executive and founder on-camera coaching
• Education-first content systems for technical and academic teams

If your work is complex and your story isn’t landing yet, that’s where I come in.
